result.execSummary:
The defendant Josie L Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Restitution is joint and several with Jaccqlyn Ratzloff in Iron County Case #16CF28 and shall be paid to the Iron County District Attorney's Office for distribution to victim(s).

Defendant shall contact the Iron County Sheriff's Department at (715) 561-2440 within 10 business days of sentencing to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample.  Defendant shall also pay the surcharge for same.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

ADDRESS INFO for Josie L Johnson
Current: 13230 Agenda Rd, Butternut, WI 54514-8697 United States  (Effective: 06-26-2017)
Prior: 80083 Peeksville Rd, Butternut, WI 54514

Defendant Josie L Johnson in court with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls cases.  Cites appearances.  DA amends charge to misd. theft.  Requests 1 year probation, restitution joint and several with Jaccqlyn Ratzloff of $2270.50.  Court questions def.  Def pleads NC to misd. theft.  No coercion.  Court witholds sentence, places def on probation for 1 year, Rest of $2270.50 joint and several ordered as requested, one set of costs, def to provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  If financial obligations are not paid during probation, may be converted to civil judgment.  Def can pay as low as $10 per month per court.  Adj.  klr
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 30, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Josie L Johnson appeared via phone with attorney Joseph Stephen Hoffmann present in person.  Matthew J Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case, cites appearances.  To be rescheduled.  Victims are present and advised of status.  To be notified of new date.  Adj.  klr
for Modification of Bail/Bond Conditions

Defendant Josie L. Johnson appeared in person, in custody.  Matthew J. Tingstad appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA calls case at 12:04 p.m.  Cites appearances.  Requests cash bond and gives court background for request.  Asks for $500 cash bond or more.  Per court, no new bond to be set on this case, omnibus bond to be set.  $500 cash changed to signature if def goes to Koinonia.  Adj.  klr
